items.title: git checkout -b {{branch_name}}
items.subtitle: Create and switch to a new branch:

items.title: git checkout -b {{branch_name}} {{reference}}
items.subtitle: Create and switch to a new branch based on a specific reference (branch, remote/branch, tag are examples of valid references):

items.title: git checkout {{branch_name}}
items.subtitle: Switch to an existing local branch:

items.title: git checkout -
items.subtitle: Switch to the previously checked out branch:

items.title: git checkout --track {{remote_name}}/{{branch_name}}
items.subtitle: Switch to an existing remote branch:

items.title: git checkout .
items.subtitle: Discard all unstaged changes in the current directory (see `git reset` for more undo-like commands):

items.title: git checkout {{file_name}}
items.subtitle: Discard unstaged changes to a given file:

items.title: git checkout {{branch_name}} -- {{file_name}}
items.subtitle: Replace a file in the current directory with the version of it committed in a given branch:
